fact: A German doctor discovered the COVID-19 vaccines include graphene oxide or graphene hydroxide, and the full list of ingredients is secret because of the emergency use authorization.

articles.title: COVID-19 vaccines do not contain graphene, are not ... - PolitiFact
articles.snippet: Jan 24, 2022 ... A German doctor discovered the COVID-19 vaccines include graphene oxide or graphene hydroxide, and the full list of ingredients is secret ...
articles.summary:
A viral video includes a laundry list of previously debunked claims about COVID-19 vaccines, offered by people known for spreading misinformation.
Those speaking in the video say a German doctor discovered that the COVID-19 vaccines include graphene oxide or graphene hydroxide.
A Pfizer spokesperson in October confirmed that while graphene oxide is used in some vaccines, it is not used at Pfizer and is not in its COVID-19 vaccine.
Despite Pavlevsky’s assertion that "we do not know the full list of ingredients," those lists have been published by manufacturers.
Our rulingA Facebook post links to a video that says a German doctor discovered the COVID-19 vaccines include graphene oxide or graphene hydroxide.

articles.title: Sovren Media - Bias and Credibility - Media Bias/Fact Check
articles.snippet: Jan 23, 2024 ... A German doctor discovered the COVID-19 vaccines include graphene oxide or graphene hydroxide, and the full list of ingredients is secret ...
articles.summary:
The platform claims to be “uncensored, blockchain-based, decentralized news and entertainment.” However, Sovren Media has come under scrutiny for hosting conspiracy-related content, including COVID-19 and monkeypox conspiracies.
According to Axios, Swann’s credibility has faced scrutiny due to his association with conspiracy theories like Pizzagate and Kremlin propaganda involvement.
Analysis / BiasSovren Media, a platform known for its alternative media content, often presents perspectives that diverge significantly from mainstream narratives.
(M. Huitsing 01/23/2024)Source: https://sovren.mediaLast Updated on January 23, 2024 by Media Bias Fact CheckDo you appreciate our work?
Right Bias: How we rate the bias of media sources

articles.title: Antimicrobial Photodynamic Therapy: Latest Developments with a ...
articles.snippet: Major MDR bacteria have been found susceptible to antimicrobial PDT (aPDT), independently of their drug-resistance profiles [10,11]. To date, resistance to aPDT ...
articles.summary:
It should be noticed that aPDT is sometimes referred to as photodynamic antimicrobial chemotherapy, light-based antimicrobial therapy, photo-controlled antimicrobial therapy, or antimicrobial photo-inactivation.
More effective aPDT systems are continuously developed, notably via combinatory approaches using multiple chemical systems and/or modalities.
The next section focusing on “combinatorial strategies” partly overlaps with the description of aPDT systems, which further complicates the classification process.
Improved PSs based on conjugated polymers or polymerized PSs with antimicrobial photodynamic properties have been amply reported in recent years [ 299 303 ].
Their aPDT properties are mostly due to a high ROS production following Type I mechanism ( Figure 1 A).

articles.snippet: He lived in La Colonia ... The fast is also a heartfelt prayer for purification and strengthening for all those who work beside me in the farm worker movement.
articles.summary:
The Story of Cesar ChavezThe Story of Cesar ChavezTHE BEGINNINGThe story of Cesar Estrada Chavez begins near Yuma, Arizona.
THE UNITED FARM WORKERS IS BORNIn 1962 Cesar founded the National Farm Workers Association, later to become the United Farm Workers – the UFW.
THE LAST MARCH WITH CESAR CHAVEZOn April 29, 1993, Cesar Estrada Chavez was honored in death by those he led in life.
But, Cesar Chavez, who insisted that those who labor in the earth were entitled to share fairly in the rewards of their toil, would never be forgotten.
Cesar Chavez left our world better than he found it, and his legacy inspires us still.

articles.title: David Alameel lived in La Colonia in California, but it ... - PolitiFact
articles.snippet: Jul 2, 2014 ... Says he lived in a colonia while working as a farm worker. true false. Immigration · Candidate Biography · Poverty · Texas · David Alameel. By W ...
articles.summary:
Alameel told us the three-bedroom, one-bath house that was his home had typical amenities including running water and electricity and sewer services.
So, the Colonia neighborhood of Alameel’s past doesn’t fit the definition commonly used in Texas to describe a residential area lacking basic utilities.
The house had no electricity and no running water, Alameel said, making his life tougher than what he’d encounter as an American.
Alameel later called back, saying he didn’t mean to suggest in his speech that he lived in a colonia meeting any federal definition.
Alameel resided for a couple of years in a low-income Oxnard, Calif., neighborhood called La Colonia.

articles.title: Farmworker housing opens with a celebration
articles.snippet: Aug 26, 2022 ... Colonia Paz I, a new housing development by the Farmworker ... He said living in Colonia Paz was the first time he felt heard and ...
articles.summary:
Colonia Paz I, a new housing development by the Farmworker Housing Development Corporation (FHDC), officially opened to residents in June, but COVID-19 delayed any official celebration.
The goal of each FHDC development is to provide more than roofs over heads, FHDC development consultant Jamie Melton said.
Colonia Paz translates to “community of peace.”Thirteen farmworkers and families have moved into the 24-unit apartment complex so far.
He said living in Colonia Paz was the first time he felt heard and taken seriously as a resident.
Unlike the first phase, Colonia Paz II will be open to any low-income individuals or families.

And like much of the U.S., Oxnard is experiencing a lack of housing.
Oxnard’s housing crunch is different from other parts of the county because development has to be voted on by Ventura County residents.

fact: "75% of Republicans have been vaccinated" against COVID-19 in Illinois.

articles.title: No proof for lawmaker's claim that 75% of Illinois ... - PolitiFact
articles.snippet: Oct 3, 2021 ... stated on September 21, 2021 in a radio interview: “75% of Republicans have been vaccinated” against COVID-19 in Illinois. true ...
articles.summary:
In response to a Democratic Governors Association ad calling the current Illinois GOP gubernatorial candidates "anti-science," state Sen. Terri Bryant, a Republican from Murphysboro, claimed the vast majority of Illinois Republicans are vaccinated.
For this fact-check, we decided to focus on the claim that three-quarters of Illinois Republicans are vaccinated, because we hadn't heard that before.
We contacted polling experts, surveyed news coverage and reviewed state data, but found no evidence to back up Bryant’s claim.
None of the state polling experts we contacted told us they had seen data showing how many Illinois Republicans have been vaccinated either.
Illinois counties that voted for Trump in 2020 also have a lower average vaccination rate than counties that Biden won, state data show.

articles.title: Tennessee Speaker Ramsey says Republicans delivered ... - PolitiFact
articles.snippet: May 27, 2012 ... Says a federal judge "sanctions Tennessee 'birther' lawyer … for bringing a frivolous lawsuit." true. By Richard Locker • September 2 ...
articles.summary:
The Tennessee Legislature last month approved a quarter-of-a-percentage point cut in the state sales tax on grocery food, effective July 1.
That cut in the state food tax from 6 to 5½ percent went into effect Jan. 1, 2008, when Ramsey was already speaker of the Senate.
And it was double the food tax cut that Ramsey is now touting.
One question involved whether to cut the state sales tax on food, since Tennessee is one of only 11 states that still tax grocery food.
But Republicans, including Ramsey, opposed the deeper food tax cut.
